title: Understanding Fragile X Syndrome
text: Fragile X Syndrome is a genetic condition. It is important to know which gene is involved and what role it plays in the body.

title: Identifying the Gene Involved
text: Which gene is responsible for Fragile X Syndrome?

hintAnswer: producing a protein that helps brain development
title: Role of the FMR1 Gene
text: What is the role of the FMR1 gene in the body?
choices: producing a protein that helps brain development

title: Connecting the Dots
text: Now that you know the gene involved and its role, think about how a mutation in this gene could lead to Fragile X Syndrome.

hintAnswer: a genetic disorder that involves the Fragile X Messenger Ribonucleoprotein $$1$$ (FMR1) gene responsible for producing a protein that helps brain development
title: Final Answer
choices: the individual’s ability to make friends and have relationships with others
the individual’s ability to act independently in their personal care, job role, school and work tasks, and money management
a genetic disorder that involves the Fragile X Messenger Ribonucleoprotein $$1$$ (FMR1) gene responsible for producing a protein that helps brain development
when a fetus is exposed to alcohol during the prenatal period
